title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 March 2009 - XWiki

Choose something and shoot a mail to dev list. . arunreddy - (27/03/2009 11:58): you will get lots of ideas.. arunreddy - (27/03/2009 11:58): you will get lots of help from there. Yas2 - (27/03/2009 11:58): k Yas2 - (27/03/2009 11:59): i got help from some srilankan guy , who also referred to u Yas2 - (27/03/2009 12:00): arun Yas2 - (27/03/2009 12:04): wat shld i expose as idont have any work in this field except the familiarity with some technical skills, also i m new to open source development arunreddy - (27/03/2009 12:04): yeah.!! ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:05): expose your ideas connected to the project you prefer and stuff arunreddy - (27/03/2009 12:06): hey when i started 5 days back ...everything is new to me.. arunreddy - (27/03/2009 12:06): even am new.. its my first time at gsoc.!! Yas2 - (27/03/2009 12:06): ok Yas2 - (27/03/2009 12:06): okhey ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:06): me too arunreddy - (27/03/2009 12:07): if you are interested go through the tutorials.. get to know what is xwiki. speak to people out here.. learn and implement. arunreddy - (27/03/2009 12:08): thanks ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:08): application .. i am refering to that Cv ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/03/2009 12:08): good luck ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:08): wait Yas2 ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:08): i will look it up ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:08): and give you the link Yas2 - (27/03/2009 12:09): u guys are very helpful Yas2 - (27/03/2009 12:09): thanx for cooperation arunreddy - (27/03/2009 12:10): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/student+application+form ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:10): http://socghop.appspot.com/org/show/google/gsoc2009/xwiki here it is ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:10): all you need to know :) arunreddy - (27/03/2009 12:10): is this the one..? ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:10): here you cand find the application template, mailing list and all ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 12:12): you're welcome ChathuraPrabudd1 - (27/03/2009 12:14): I had upload the functional view of Survey application http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/ChathuraPrabuddha Harshana - (27/03/2009 12:15): the aplication template is at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/student+application+form Harshana - (27/03/2009 12:15): thanks chatura ChathuraPrabudd1 - (27/03/2009 12:15): Hope this will help you in designing the archtecture of your application Harshana - (27/03/2009 12:16): sure. good work ChathuraPrabudd1 - (27/03/2009 12:16): This is only the functional view of the application ChathuraPrabudd1 - (27/03/2009 12:18): It need a another part which will show how it get plug in to the Xwiki architecture ChathuraPrabudd1 - (27/03/2009 12:19): I'm still developing it plan to add it next few days xwikibot - (27/03/2009 12:22): XWiki.ChathuraPrabuddha was modified by XWiki.ChathuraPrabuddha - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/ChathuraPrabuddha xwikibot - (27/03/2009 12:24): XWiki.zine was modified by XWiki.zine (Created user) - http://workspaces.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/zine xwikibot - (27/03/2009 13:45): XWiki.MartinhoPatricio was modified by XWiki.XWikiGuest (Rollback to version 4.1) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/MartinhoPatricio ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 13:48): hi sdumitriu sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 13:49): Hi ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 13:50): when will i get a feedback for my application? so i can  make improvements sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 13:51): Today sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 13:51): Right away ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 13:51): great , thank you :) xwikibot - (27/03/2009 14:13): XWiki.glardDiarlNig was modified by XWiki.glardDiarlNig (Created user) - http://curriki.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/glardDiarlNig mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:28): Hi mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:28): I need the assistance for Gsoc ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/03/2009 15:28): Ok this is for all the new commers to foss & Gsoc like me  please visit my blog http://gacpganegoda.blogspot.com/  It will help you to learn something. I'm gatheriing my GSOC experience through my blog ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/03/2009 15:29): good luck new commers.... sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:29): Hi mib\_albnxp mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:29): hi sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:29): What do you need? mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:30): Actually I need to work on project of Improved Bullitien Board mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:30): I have some ideas for that I need to discuss them ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 15:31): sdumitriu , that's for your reply .. i will get to work ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 15:32): but about those ideas that are already implemented, shall i ignore them when i'll make a plan? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:33): It depends sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:33): The implementation part yes sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:33): But you can mention them in the general overview of the security features ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 15:34): oh , then i shall present how i plan to integrate the already implemented features? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:34): Yes mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:35): sdumitriu , I need to implement Improved Bullitien board ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 15:35): ok, thank you ! sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:35): ancutagheorghe: You're welcome sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:35): Sorry for the delay ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/03/2009 15:35): Hai sdumitriu sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:36): mib\_albnxp: Well, you should be the one leading the conversation; go ahead and present your ideas and ask questions sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:36): ChathuraPrabuddh: Hi ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 15:36): it's ok, in the meanwhile i got familiar with xwiki :) .. so it was good :) mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:36): fyn mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:36): I am sorry for delay mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:37): Actually I want to know the implementation language & platform forthis mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:37): Actually I had experience of working on ajax , Php, Mysql ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/03/2009 15:38): I had uploaded my  application today if u havv time please hav a look and give me a feedback sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:38): The code will be written in Velocity, using a Java API mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:39): Actually I had seen the previous Bullitien board of Xwiki mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:41): In the project of calender application my idea is to make the calender so that user can modify it according to hi, mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:41): him\* mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:42): means if someone wanted to add his features to the calender like displaying something he needed he can mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 15:43): sdumitriu, r u there??? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:46): Yes arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:47): sdumitriu : hi sergiu, is ludovic around. ? arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:48): is he here ..i mean..!!! sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:48): Yes sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:48): Ping ldubost arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:48): pinged him sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:48): Hm, maybe he's busy arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:48): ok sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:49): I'm not in the same place with him arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:49): ok arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:49): i have one query sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:49): Go ahead, I'll try to answer arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:49): recently i learnt from tutorials that component is preferred to plugin sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:49): Yes sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:50): But in a way they are similar sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:50): It's just that you're not bound to an interface anymore arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:50): yeah of course.. but components are more flexible sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:50): They both offer an extension arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:51): i had written a plugin similiar to EXCEL plugin for publishing the Document arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:51): using Apache POI.. sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:52): Publish as what? arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:53): put the text in the document into the xwiki space arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:53): plain text. arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:53): want to make it a component.. but how can i design the archetype jar file arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:53): be cause in the writin component tut .. you have given two archetype jars .that made my work easy in building them. . arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:54): how can i make the intial archetype jar file./ arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:54): ? arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:54): and corresponding archetype meta information sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:54): There are 2 approaches sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:55): One is to use the maven archetype creator sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:55): The second is to copy the pom from another component sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:55): And adapt it arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:55): ok arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:56): where can i get the archetype creator.. ? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:57): Wait a bit arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:58): yeah for sure arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:58): take your time arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:58): :) sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:58): http://maven.apache.org/guides/getting-started/maven-in-five-minutes.html sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:58): "Creating a Project" sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:58): You don't need to get anything except the maven runtime sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:58): This is one of the best features of Maven sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:58): You don't have to bother searching for stuff arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:59): Cool sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 15:59): It knows where to look arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:59): ok thats nice.. !! arunreddy - (27/03/2009 15:59): i shall check it out. arunreddy - (27/03/2009 16:00): Thanks a lot sergiu mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:04): sdumitriu: Is there any way that I can add usermodifiable features to calender like I google?? mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:04): igoogle\* sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:04): Sure mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:04): so it would be done by Ajax sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:04): XWiki applications are written directly in the wiki sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:05): So any user can modify them mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:05): So features like todays event mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:05): remainder mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:05): can also be added... sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:06): Yes ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:07): oh for the calendar project .. i have some ideas .. i do not intend to apply for this project .. but i want to share them with you, they may be useful ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:07): last semester i did something similar mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:07): yaa plzzzzzzzz ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:08): and a teacher of mine recomended to read Getting Things Done ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:08): let me check the author mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:08): plzzz ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:08): the author is david allan ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/03/2009 16:09): Hai serigue I had mailed the PDF of the application it will be clear than online application mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:09): Actually I found this project very Interesting ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:09): this book presents a GREAT way to organize yourself .. ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:09): and with a calendar appplication is great mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:09): You are saying about some ideas for this project ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:10): yes .. because this calendar project can help people organize .. this is one of it's purposes i guess sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:10): mib\_albnxp: Tip: Learn to be more patient ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:10): most of the people i know use a calendar for better organization ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:11): you should really read that book, it will provide you GREAT ideas mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:11): fine I ll read this book ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:11): :) mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:12): Sorry for that sdumitriu ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:14): oh sdumitriu , do you remember that i had problems integrating xwiki with tomcat and mysql? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:14): Yes sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:14): Did you succeed? ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:14): no matter what i did .. it was in a "stopped" state ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:14): i started editing web.xml ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:15): and after different deletes and writes ...  i just deletes 2 lines .. and it became running ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:15): but it has errors kiransarv - (27/03/2009 16:15): hi sergiu, detection of bad edits is a classification problem. So we can have a two class classifier which can classify a bad and good edit. The problem will be to have a training data and also the notion of good and bad will be different for each domain. ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:16): and for now i have the standalone working .. but it doesn't help me very much .. because i can not edit tables etc sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:21): ancutagheorghe: Why do you need to edit tables? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:22): And you can do that with hsqldb also sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:22): kiransarv: You could start with some obvious samples and then do a continuous, online trainig of the classifier sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:22): This separation only has meaning for large public sites, where there are lots of edits that can be used as training data ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:23): i was thinking about tables for lists .. black lists , white lists ... sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:24): Heh, just update the mapping file sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:24): Hibernate auto-creates the tables at startup ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:24): ok :) ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:25): REALLY? ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:25): i think i should start reading about hibernate :D mib\_albnxp - (27/03/2009 16:28): sdumitriu : In the calneder project from where can I start working on it??? kiransarv - (27/03/2009 16:33): wikipedia provides all versions for each page...! So a page which has been classified as a "bad edit" or "spam" by admin might be mined. Also there has been research done on detection of spam in blogs and comments... I will look into these as a starting point. amila325 - (27/03/2009 16:42): hi sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:42): Hi amila325 amila325 - (27/03/2009 16:42): where can i find the previous Photo album in XWiki sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:42): Wait a bit amila325 - (27/03/2009 16:42): k sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:44): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/photoalbum/ amila325 - (27/03/2009 16:44): thanks, im interested in GSOC photo album application sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:44): You can see it live here: http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Photos/ xwikibot - (27/03/2009 16:47): GoogleSummerOfCode.student application form was modified by xwiki:XWiki.Sergiu - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/student+application+form sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:48): SoC students, it is important to answer the "have you applied for other projects" question, to let us know what your general interests and abilities are sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:48): Listing other organizations does not diminish your chances of being accepted with us sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:48): But it gives us a more general view of you ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:50): ok :) sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:51): Looks like there are a lot of students interested in the AntiVandalism project this year... sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:51): Last year alsmot nobody wanted it ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:52): :) ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:52): if i want to apply for another project as well, in case i will not be chosen for this one .. do i have to make an entore plan for that one as well? ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:52): entire\* sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:53): Not yet ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:53): what do you mean? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:53): For the moment it is enough to spend most of your effort on one project ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:54): and when will i know if it is necessary to focus on something else? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:55): If in the next few days we think that a student is better for a different project (given that Google does not like more than one student on a project), we'll contact you to propose the change ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/03/2009 16:55): Ya I'm also agree with u.Through that we can concentrate really well sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:55): Then you will have to invest into that project as well sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 16:55): Right now it's too early to tell ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:55): ok, it's good that i have the time to focus only on this one ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 16:55): :) ChathuraPrabuddh - (27/03/2009 16:56): :)nice advice sdumitriu amila325 - (27/03/2009 17:03): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/EventCalendar amila325 - (27/03/2009 17:03): in here calendar is not working amila325 - (27/03/2009 17:04): sdumitriu do you have any working link xwikibot - (27/03/2009 17:05): XWiki.geonginosmeli was modified by XWiki.geonginosmeli (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/geonginosmeli sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 17:06): http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/EventCalendar amila325 - (27/03/2009 17:09): thanks for the link wasja - (27/03/2009 17:21): sdumitriu: can I ask you, how many students are interested in AntiVandalusm project this year? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 17:22): At least 4 (5, if you're also interested in it) ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 17:23): oh wasja - (27/03/2009 17:23): sdumitriu: thanks, very good :) ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 17:24): challenging :) ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 17:24): sdumitriu , i have a small question .. i just don't undertsand something ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 17:25): in the browser i have this path http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ but i can't seem to find a bin folder ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 17:25): how is that? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 17:25): bin is a servlet ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 17:25): i looked in files .. maybe it's mapped somehow .. but i didn't find the answer sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 17:26): In web.xml ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 17:26): ok, thank you ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:50): sdumitriu , still around? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:50): Yes ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:51): i am sorry i am insisting on the this subject .. but if i will not find the answer, i won't be able to sleep tonight :D ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:51): you said that bin is a servlet ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:52): but as i knew servlet is a piece of code .. ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:52): and this for example   ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:52):     404 ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:52):     /bin/view/Main/DocumentDoesNotExist ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:52):    ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:52): makes me really confused ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:52): because i would normally think that this is a path ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:52): but i can not find this anywhere sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:53): It is a path, but not a real path ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:53): how come? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:54): It's an application path that gets used internally using a request dispatcher ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:54): if you have a link to recommend so i will not waste you time ... it would be great sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:54): Yes, the servlet specification :) sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:54): But it's quite big for a short read ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:55): i do not understand the idea behind this .. it's killing me :D ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:55): and i am so curious sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:56): The idea is that a web application has ONLY servlets sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:56): Each servlet is mapped to certain URLs sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:56): Either by a prefix, or by an extension sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:56): This mapping is done in web.xml sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:57): There's also the server-wide configuration that is used as a basis for this mapping sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:57): In this server-wide config, a default servlet is mapped for all paths ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:57): so for example i have this sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:57): This is how real files are returned ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:57): ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:57): action ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:57): /bin/\* ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:57): ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:57): /bin/\* doesn't exist ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:57): but action does .. and action is a what? ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:58): the name of the servlet sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:58): The container does not implicitly know how to return files from the filesystem, there's a servlet that does this ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:58): right? ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:58): and these servlets where are located ? because i could only find js and vm and the jars ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 18:59): it looks so simple but somehow it doesn't click in my head :) sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:59): "action" is declard above sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:59): In a tag sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:59): It points to the Struts entry point sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:59): Internally, requests are processed using a request dispatcher sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 18:59): The servlets are compiled java classes ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:00): perfect ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:00): now it makes sense ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:00): thanks a lot ! sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:00): You can see: sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:00):    sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:00):     redirectHomeServlet sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:00):     com.xpn.xwiki.web.HomePageRedirectServlet sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:00): The servlet-class is a java class name ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:00): yes and that i know where it is ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:01): it's so different in the real world programming sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:01): You can find this one inside WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-core-1.x.jar sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:01): The bin one is inside struts-1.2.9.jar ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:01): and do i need to know struts? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:02): Struts is a framework built on top of Servlets sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:02): http://struts.apache.org/ sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:02): You don't need to learn about it sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:02): It's simple to use ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:02): oh i want to ...it seems really smart .. just like hibernate sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:02): We also have an extra wrapper around it, so it's easier to write actions ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:03): i was impressed when you told me that hibernate creates the tables at sturtup ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:03): startup sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:03): Besides, we're not using it properly ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:03): how come? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:03): It's a MVC framework, which is supposed to ease an application design sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:03): You can design the whole workflow in an XML file sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:03): But we're not making use of this feature ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:04): is there a reason? sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:04): No sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:04): Maybe just commodity ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:04): :) ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:04): make a project with this subject :D sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:05): We just like Velocity, so we do our workflow using it jaipster - (27/03/2009 19:05): hi can somebody help about GSOC project XWiki Jabber Gtalk integration sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:05): We could, but I'd rather not ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:05): yes a printed a velocity tutorial today to learn it sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:05): I think we'll drop Struts soon sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:06): In The Big Grand Major Redesign of XWiki ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:06): it's the first time i hear about it .. it seems really smart .. and seems easy ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:06): that will take a lot of time ancutagheorghe - (27/03/2009 19:06): but i am sure it will be worth it sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:06): jaipster: I can try jaipster - (27/03/2009 19:07): sdumitriu :that would great of you sdumitriu - (27/03/2009 19:08): What do you need to know?
